page.title: 02HOUSING
page.content: Much of the land usage is residential. People live mainly in houses or flats built in the last 100 years. Most are brick houses built since 1945 by the Council to house surplus population in Wolverhampton. The few,Victorian terraced houses are small,dark, lacking front gardens and sited in straight treeless streets. These now house immigrants of Asian or West Indian origin and poorer people. Modern houses are larger,better equipped and set in more congenial open areas with curved grass verged tree-lined roads. Many people buy their Council houses and refurbish them. High-rise Council flats allow many people to use small areas of land but this causes occasional community problems particularly for families with children. Flats share well tended gardens and play areas.
